tool.name: RandomSampleImages

param.name: input_feature
param.dialogReference:
Input feature class to use as the sample generator. Needs to be a point feature.

If using the output of the segmentation validator feature, then this should be either the nodes to split or nodes to merge feature.

param.name: output_folder
param.dialogReference: Folder to output the sample images to.

param.name: sample_size
param.dialogReference:
Number of samples to generate images of. Will default to 25% of the total count. Alternatively, if you want all the features use the total count or a bigger number.

ie: 250 features, to generate sample images of all items set sample_size to 250 or greater.

param.name: map_scale
param.dialogReference:
Scale of the output images. If you're looking for very small joins, the scale should be very small.

Scale must be >= 1.9. Anything less as an input will default to 1.9.

Additionally, a bug in 10.4 exists. Don't know about newer versions.

if the scale is 1 < X < 2 the output will be equal to 1:0.X. IE: 1.9 == 1:0.9; 1.08 == 1.08

If the scale is >= 2, the output scale wil lbe equal to 1:X. IE: 2.5 == 1:2.5

param.name: map_mxd
param.dialogReference: input MXD to generate images from. Setup your symbology and labling before outputting. Recommend symbolizing the feature class for a unique item for each input ID. Will stand out on the output images that way. Additionally setting up lableling on individual features will also be easier to read during output.

tool.summary: Generate images of a specified point feature. Useful for quickly validating output of tools such as segmentation validator as you can run it at a very small scale.
tool.usage:
Requires an existing MXD file to iterate over. Will run in the background as it is much faster then operating on the active view port of the map document. To use your current map (with all the symbology/labeling) save the map, and use that mxd as the MXD input.

Will default to outputting 25% of the total count of the input feature class. File names will be the ObjectID of the input feature.
